name: Titanium.UI.iPad.Popover
summary: A Popover is used to manage the presentation of content in a popover.

parameters.name: options
parameters.summary: Display properties to use when hiding the popover.

parameters.name: params
parameters.summary: Display properties to use when displaying the popover.

properties.name: contentView
properties.summary: Indicates the arrow direction of the popover.
properties.description:
Use this property to indicate the popover arrows to use. You can bitwise-OR the constant values together.

Do not set this property to POPOVER_ARROW_DIRECTION_UNKNOWN.

properties.name: backgroundColor
properties.summary: Sets the background color of the popover.
properties.description: It is recommended to set this property to colorize the whole popover instead of only its content view.

properties.name: contentView
properties.summary: View to use for the popover content. Must be set before calling the show() method.
properties.description:
Set this property to any Titanium.UI.View object, including a Titanium.UI.Window or Titanium.UI.NavigationWindow object.

This property does not support the Titanium.UI.iPad.SplitWindow or Titanium.UI.TabGroup objects.

When this property is set to a valid object, the popover does not include the navigation controller unless it is set to a Titanium.UI.NavigationWindow object.

In an Alloy application, you can specify this property as a <ContentView> child element of the <Popover> element:

<Alloy>
    <Popover>
        <ContentView>
            <Window title="Popover">
                <Label>Popover!</Label>
            </Window>
        </ContentView>
    </Popover>
</Alloy

properties.name: height

deprecated.notes: This property is deprecated. Set the height on the contentView property instead.

properties.description:
Defaults to: If undefined, defaults to either FILL or SIZE depending on the view. See "View Types and Default Layout Behavior" in Transitioning to the New UI Layout System.

Can be either a float value or a dimension string (for example, '50%' or '40dp'). Can also be one of the following special values:

  • SIZE. The view should size itself to fit its contents.
  • FILL. The view should size itself to fill its parent.
  • 'auto'. Represents the default sizing behavior for a given type of view. The use of 'auto' is deprecated, and should be replaced with the SIZE or FILL constants if it is necessary to set the view's behavior explicitly.

This is an input property for specifying the view's height dimension. To determine the view's size once rendered, use the rect or size properties.

properties.name: leftNavButton
properties.summary: Left button in the navigation area of the popover.
properties.description:
Ignored when contentView is set.

In an Alloy application, you can specify this property as a <LeftNavButton> child element of the <Popover> element:

<Alloy>
    <Popover>
        <LeftNavButton>
            <Button onClick='showAlert'>Alert</Button>
        </LeftNavButton>
    </Popover>
</Alloy>

properties.name: passthroughViews
properties.summary: Passthrough views to use when the popover is shown.
properties.description: Specify view objects that the user can interact with while the popover is open. While interacting with these view, the popover will not be dismissed.

properties.name: rightNavButton
properties.summary: Right button in the navigation area of the popover.
properties.description:
Ignored when contentView is set.

In an Alloy application, you can specify this property as a <RightNavButton> child element of the <Popover> element:

<Alloy>
    <Popover>
        <RightNavButton>
            <Button onClick='showAlert'>Alert</Button>
        </RightNavButton>
    </Popover>
</Alloy>

properties.name: title
properties.summary: Title of the navigation area of the popover.

properties.name: width

deprecated.notes: This property is deprecated. Set the width on the contentView property instead.

properties.description:
Defaults to: If undefined, defaults to either FILL or SIZE depending on the view. See "View Types and Default Layout Behavior" in Transitioning to the New UI Layout System.

Can be either a float value or a dimension string (for example, '50%' or '40dp'). Can also be one of the following special values:

  • SIZE. The view should size itself to fit its contents.
  • FILL. The view should size itself to fill its parent.
  • 'auto'. Represents the default sizing behavior for a given type of view. The use of 'auto' is deprecated, and should be replaced with the SIZE or FILL constants if it is necessary to set the view's behavior explicitly.

This is an input property for specifying the view's width dimension. To determine the view's size once rendered, use the rect or size properties.
